Real Interest Rate Trend Signal

Real yields and trend momentum as a macro-financial tightening indicator.

As of 2026-01-10

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The US 10-Year Real Yield Signal is currently in a Bearish regime, indicating restrictive monetary conditions as of 2025-12-01 (1).
  • This reflects a persistent state where the real yield is above its medium-term trend (1).
  • Conviction Band: Medium, Interpretation Confidence: Mixed Signals, Internal Conflict Flag: Yes.

Key Dynamics:

  • As of 2025-12-01, the 10-year real yield (2.04%) is 0.145 percentage points above its 6-month trend (1.895%), clearly classifying as "Bearish" (1).
  • However, the latest entry for 2026-01-01 in the provided data also shows "Bearish", despite the real yield (1.85%) being only 0.01 percentage points above its trend (1.84%) (1).
  • According to the methodology, a difference within ±0.05% should result in a "Neutral" classification, suggesting an inconsistency in the most recent tabulated signal (1).
  • Conditional Invalidation: The 10-year real yield consistently falls below its 6-month trend by more than 0.05 percentage points, signaling accommodative conditions (1).

Scenario Balance:

  • Base Case dominant: Real yields remain elevated relative to their trend, sustaining restrictive monetary conditions, supported by the signal's historical pattern.
  • Upside secondary: A significant decline in real yields or a convergence with its trend could shift the signal to Neutral or Bullish, indicating easing financial conditions.
  • Downside residual: Further increases in real yields, or an accelerating trend, would reinforce tightening conditions.

Time Horizon & Aggregation:

  • Time Horizon: Cyclical (months), reflecting the 6-month moving average employed in the signal's trend calculation (1).
  • Aggregation Weight Hint: High, as it provides a clear, albeit nuanced, read on real interest rate dynamics which are crucial for macro assessment.

Macro Relevance:

  • Macro dimension informed: Liquidity, pricing (inflation expectations via real rates), and broader monetary conditions (1).
  • Cycle position: Often indicative of late-cycle tightening or disinflationary pressures.
  • Typical interaction with other macro signals: Influences gold regimes (2) and affects credit conditions (3) and growth outlooks like housing (4).

Data & References:

  • 10-Year Treasury Inflation-Indexed Security (DFII10) real yield from FRED, latest value 2.04% as of 2025-12-01 (1).
  • The `Real_Yield_DFII10` and its `DFII10_Trend` (6-month moving average) are the most influential datapoints (1).
  • Additional public datasets: CPIAUCSL (Consumer Price Index) for general inflation context and GS10 (10-Year Treasury Constant Maturity Rate) for nominal yield insights, both from FRED.
